mobs.long_desc: A large rhino is standing here eating some grass.
mobs.desc: This rhino is a massive beast.  It stands over five feet tall and weighs several tons.  Its skin is a dark gray color and is very thick and wrinkled. Its horn is the most magnificent part of it and is about a foot in length.  It feeds completely on plants and grasses, and will have no trouble finding food here.

mobs.long_desc: A large lioness prowls around here, looking over the plains carefully.
mobs.desc: Golden fur gleaming in the sunlight, the notorious lioness prowls the plains in search of prey.  Anything smaller or weaker than her is considered fair game by those ruthless brown eyes that flicker back and forth, noticing every tiny detail of her world and marking her prey like the perfect killing machine she is.  Anything that would prove a challenge to her could surely be taken down by a pack of these glorious beasts.

mobs.long_desc: A large golden lion rests in the shade here.
mobs.desc: This is the king of the plains, the lion.  He is about seven feet long with a rather impressive mane around his neck.  His large tail sways in the wind as he rests here.  He watches the plains very closely ready to spring up if anything passes by near him.

mobs.long_desc: A small lion cub is here playing in the sand.
mobs.desc: This lion cub looks rather cute, but in a couple years he will not be so cute and will be a ruthless killer.  The cub is only about two feet long and his fur is a nice golden yellow color.  He seems to show no interest in anything but the sand that he is tossing around.

mobs.long_desc: A large wildebeest stands here enjoying some grass.
mobs.desc: This wildebeest is one of the larger antelopes known to exist.  It has a short black mane that covers most of its face.  Its long tail sways in the wind as it nibbles at all the grass it can find.  Its two large horns on the top of its head serve as a reminder that it is not to be messed with.

mobs.long_desc: A brown vulture flies overhead here looking for something to eat.
mobs.desc: This vulture is one of the most repelling birds that exist in the realm.  It is also quite large with a wingspan of about six feet.  The vulture is well known as a scavenger and can clean out a carcass in a matter of minutes.  It flies over the plains now in search of a meal to steal from a lion or hyena.

mobs.long_desc: A large black and white striped zebra stands here, eating some grass.
mobs.desc: The zebra is one of one of the most interesting species in the realm.  It looks to be just like a horse except for one thing: the unusual black and white stripes that cover its entire body.  Zebras have a unique defense where they stay in large groups.  Their combined stripes make it harder for a enemy to distinguish where they are and often miss them.  This zebra would be a very tasty treat for a carnivore, so it must always be on the lookout for anything out of the ordinary.

mobs.long_desc: A brown hyena is standing here looking around for something to eat.
mobs.desc: This is the notorious laughing hyena.  He is a vicious hunter but cannot do much on his own.  To do any real damage he needs the help of several other hyenas.  His dull brown skin hides him quite well, making him almost invisible to his prey.

mobs.long_desc: A large elephant is standing here looking around for some plants to eat.
mobs.desc: This is the elephant, the largest land mammal there is.  Everything about her is huge.  Her legs are like large stone pillars her ears are enormous and flap freely in the wind.  Her tusks must be at least five feet long and could be very deadly if used on anything.  It is no wonder she has no natural enemies.

mobs.long_desc: A baby elephant is standing here eating some grass hungrily.
mobs.desc: This baby elephant is quite large for his age.  He looks to already be three feet long and is continuing to grow quickly.  His tusks are just starting to develop along with the rest of his body.  His skin is thick and is a dark gray color, but it is not near as dark as his mothers.

mobs.long_desc: A large crocodile floats here, just below the water's surface.
mobs.desc: This is a very smart and cunning crocodile.  It has placed itself in the very middle of the water hole where every animal in the plains must come to drink. It floats just below the waters surface, keeping itself barely visible to anyone.  It is about eight feet in length and has a large mouth with hundreds of teeth inside that could crush any animal into oblivion.

mobs.long_desc: A slender cheetah stands here, searching for its next meal.
mobs.desc: One of the fastest land animals, this cheetah was built for speed.  Slender and light, the cat's whole frame was designed to maximize its running ability. Black spots cover its golden hide, creating a pattern perfect for blending in with the grasslands, its normal hunting grounds.

mobs.long_desc: A large giraffe stands here eating some leaves off of a tree.
mobs.desc: This giraffe is one of the tallest mammals in the realm, and uses its height to gain access to the leaves high up on the trees.  The giraffe is a beige color with many large brown spots patterned all over its body.  Its size makes it almost impossible to kill, unless the predators are in a large group.

mobs.long_desc: A green snake is here, making its way through the grass.
mobs.desc: This snake is only about four feet in length and looks quite harmless.  Its scales are a dull green color, which makes it almost unseen in the tall grasses of the plains.  Only the movement of grasses shows its presence before it strikes.

mobs.long_desc: A small bird hops around here, looking for some seeds to eat.
mobs.desc: This small bird is barely noticeable as it hops around in search for food. Its wings are a dull brown color that help the bird blend in with the grasses that surround it.  It chirps from time to time filling the plains with a delightful sound.

mobs.long_desc: A large lioness rests here, looking over her cubs.
mobs.desc: The notorious lioness of the Gothra Plains rests here, looking benevolently down upon the cubs she guards.  It is not always the duty of the actual mother of lion cubs to remain in the den and watch them while the others are hunting, but it is still an important duty, for upon it rests the future of their entire species.

mobs.long_desc: A large wildebeest stands here, drinking water from the stream.
mobs.desc: The wildebeest, or gnu, is one of the larger antelopes known to exist.  Its large eyes give the impression of stupidity, but these wild beasts are far from complacent and will fight back stubbornly if attacked.  This particular specimen watches the surrounding area carefully as it drinks from the stream, tail swishing back and forth to keep biting insects at bay.

mobs.keywords: zebra large black white striped drinking-zebra
mobs.long_desc: A striped zebra stands at the edge of the water hole, drinking some water.
mobs.desc: The zebra is an intriguing horselike animal with distinctive black-and-white stripes running up and down its body.  Legend holds that each zebra's pattern is unique and distinctive, and when a large group of them get together it is certainly hard to tell one from another.  This one seems rather skittish. Perhaps this zebra senses a predator.

mobs.long_desc: A light brown gazelle stands here, looking for some grass to eat.
mobs.desc: This gazelle is one of the faster animals on the plains.  It hops and runs around the plains avoiding any predators that might be looking to kill it. Its coat is a beige and white color, with two long black horns protruding from the top of its head.

mobs.long_desc: A small lizard is sunning itself here.
mobs.desc: This small dull green lizard is only a few inches in length, and quite harmless.  It is sunning itself to get itself going for its days activities.

mobs.long_desc: A slender cheetah stands here, searching for its next meal.
mobs.desc: One of the fastest land animals, this cheetah was built for speed.  Slender and light, the cat's whole frame was designed to maximize its running ability. Black spots cover its golden hide, creating a pattern perfect for blending in with the grasslands, its normal hunting grounds.

objects.ground: A large ivory colored rhino's horn lies in the dust here.

extras.text: This is the horn of a large rhino.  It is approximately a foot in length and is a shiny ivory color.  Whatever rhino had this horn on him had to be a very large and powerful rhino.

objects.ground: A gleaming lion's tooth lies in the dust here.

extras.text: This is the sharp canine of a lion.  Its tip is razor sharp and it shines a beautiful ivory color.  This fang is a very rare and valuable treasure.

objects.ground: An ugly brown feather lies here floating with the wind.

extras.text: This is the feather of a large vulture.  The feather itself is quite ugly and dull.  It is a plain brown color and the feather is ruffled everywhere making it look messy.

objects.ground: A large crocodile-tooth necklace lies discarded here.

extras.text: This is a very interesting and intricate necklace.  It is made of an intricately braided green material and a has a large crocodile tooth at the very center.  It must have taken many hours to make this amazing necklace.

objects.ground: A large striped cloak lies in the dust here.

extras.text: This unique cloak is made out of pure zebra's fur.  The many stripes throughout the cloak give it a very intricate look.  This cloak must be very rare and valuable to skin collectors.

objects.ground: A large chunk of meat lies on the ground here.

extras.text: This is a large, tasty-looking chunk of wildebeest meat.

objects.ground: A small bracelet made of snake fangs lies on the ground here.

extras.text: This bracelet is made out of a very durable weaved grass that has several spaced out snake fangs weaved into it.  The fangs are about an inch in length and give the bracelet a menacing look.  The grass is a dull green color and it is weaved tightly so it looks almost like it is one piece of grass.

rooms.name: A Dusty Desert Path
rooms.description: The path widens a bit here, as the sand dunes seem to have retreated from the path.  The sand is immensely hot here, heated by the large sun above.  A few cacti grow along the path here, their large spines serving as a painful reminder to keep away.  The wind has calmed, and most of the flying pieces of sand and other debris have fallen back to the ground.  Even with the wind subsided it is still almost impossible to see far away, for the sun's heat waves distort all vision.  The path continues on and bends to the north, and also heads east back towards the desert.

rooms.name: A Dusty Desert Path
rooms.description: As the path continues the sight of tracks along the trail is still present. It is still not possible to make out what has these tracks are from, but this may become evident further down the path.  Scattered cacti can be found throughout the area, several of them very close to the main section of the path.  The wind has picked up in this section of the path, but not enough to carry any sand.  To the east the path continues and looks to lead into a large sand dune.  To the south the path leads back towards the beginning of the path and the desert.

rooms.name: At the Base of a Large Sand Dune
rooms.description: The path continues here, and runs itself right into a large sand dune.  The dune itself is quite large and certainly takes quite a bit of energy to scale. The sand around and on it is very loose, making it much harder to move around. The sun is hotter than ever before, and it drains the very life out of everything in sight.  The path continues up the dune, leading farther into the unknown, and back towards the beginning of the path to the west.

rooms.name: On The Sand Dune
rooms.description: The conditions look to have increased in intensity here.  The wind is the main factor that has changed here, throwing sand and dust everywhere.  The sun also has grown in intensity and seems to suck the very life out of everything in sight.  The sand does not help either, it's heat and constant shifting make traveling quite difficult.  It is hard to imagine what kind of animals live in this barren desert, but from the tracks all around the path it is evident that some kind of animals have been around here.  The path continues further into the unknown to the east, or back down the dune towards the beginning of the path and the large expanse of desert.

rooms.name: A Small Desert Path
rooms.description: The path seems to have narrowed quite a bit here and looks much harder to maneuver on now.  Now that the path is leaving the top of the sand dune, the wind has stopped blowing so hard and the dust and sand have settled.  A lone skull of what looks like a wildebeest lies in the sand here, and probably died from a lack of water.  It looks as though there is no end to all the sand, but hopefully relief will be found somewhere nearby.  The small desert path continues on to the south or back to the top of the sand dune towards the west.

rooms.name: A Small Desert Path
rooms.description: The path widens a bit here, but not enough to make traveling any easier. The sand continues to move around a bit here, but it rarely leaves the ground. The sun beats down hard, heating everything in sight and making it almost unbearable to be here.  Many different sized tracks can be seen going both ways along the path, showing that this path is used quite often by different animals as some kind of route to somewhere.  The path continues onward towards the end of the path to the east or back towards the beginning of the path to the north.

rooms.name: A Small Desert Path
rooms.description: The path widens a bit here, but not enough to make traveling any easier. The sand continues to move around a bit here, but it rarely leaves the ground. The sun beats down hard, heating everything in sight and making it almost unbearable to be here.  Many different sized tracks can be seen going both ways along the path, showing that this path is used quite often by different animals as some kind of route to somewhere.  To the east the path seems to be coming to an end and a beautiful grassland seems to be unfolding, and to the west the scorching heat of the desert lies in wait of yet another victim.

rooms.name: The Desert Path's End
rooms.description: This long desert path looks to be finally coming to an end.  The sand that once covered everything in sight is now being replaced by luscious grasses and other vegetation that grow almost everywhere.  To the north, what looks like an endless expanse of grasslands is seen as far as the eye can see, a welcome sight to anyone who has been in the desert to the west.  The path comes to its end to the north or goes back into the barren desert to the west.

rooms.name: Before the Plains
rooms.description: Everything around here has changed drastically.  The barren desert of before has transformed itself into a luscious grassland.  It appears to stretch out forever and it could be miles to its end.  The tracks seen on the path before spread out here and it is obvious that these luscious plains were the destination of those animals.  The plains continue on to the north while the path goes back towards the desert to the south.

rooms.name: The Beginning of the Plains
rooms.description: The plains spread out in almost every direction, covering everything with its radiant green color.  A few things other than grass grow here, such as a few short shrubs and a few spread out trees that can be seen in a distance. Food doesn't seem to be a problem here, the resources of this plain look to be able to feed a very large group of animals quite well.  The plains continue in all directions except to the south, where a path leads back into the desert.

rooms.name: The Beginning of the Plains
rooms.description: The plains spread out in almost every direction, covering everything with its radiant green color.  A few things other than grass grow here, such as a few short shrubs and a few spread out trees that can be seen in a distance. Food doesn't seem to be a problem here, the resources of this plain look to be able to feed a very large group of animals quite well.  The plains continue on to the north and west.  To the east and south exit is blocked by a large stone wall that seems to encircle the plains.

rooms.name: The Beginning of the Plains
rooms.description: The plains spread out in almost every direction, covering everything with its radiant green color.  A few things other than grass grow here, such as a few short shrubs and a few spread out trees that can be seen in a distance. Food doesn't seem to be a problem here, the resources of this plain look to be able to feed a very large group of animals quite well.  The plains continue on to the north and east.  To the west and south exit is blocked by a large stone wall that seems to encircle the plains.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: This is the most common sight on the plains, endless grass.  It spreads out far and wide providing an almost endless amount of food for all the animals that live here.  Almost all of the grass here is still intact, but small portions of it are gone and look to have been devoured by hungry animals. Very few things other than grass grow here, but a few small shrubs and other various small desert plants can be seen dotted along the plains.  The plains continue on in all directions.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: This is the most common sight on the plains, endless grass.  It spreads out far and wide providing an almost endless amount of food for all the animals that live here.  Almost all of the grass here is still intact, but small portions of it are gone and look to have been devoured by hungry animals. Very few things other than grass grow here, but a few small shrubs and other various small desert plants can be seen dotted along the plains.  The plains continue on in all directions.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: This is the most common sight on the plains, endless grass.  It spreads out far and wide providing an almost endless amount of food for all the animals that live here.  Almost all of the grass here is still intact, but small portions of it are gone and look to have been devoured by hungry animals. Very few things other than grass grow here, but a few small shrubs and other various small desert plants can be seen dotted along the plains.  The plains continue on in all directions.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: The plains end abruptly to the south and east where, a large wall of rock blocks any exit.  It is a mystery how these plains were made because all around them, they are surrounded by desert.  Sand blows in from over the wall of stone and flies around everywhere covering some of the green grass with its dull tan color.  A large carcass stripped clean of all meat lies against the wall, it must have been good meal for the lions that roam these plains.  The plains continue onward to the north and west

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: The plains end abruptly to the south and west where, a large wall of rock blocks any exit.  It is a mystery how these plains were made because all around them, they are surrounded by desert.  Sand blows in from over the wall of stone and flies around everywhere covering some of the green grass with its dull tan color.  The wall is at its shortest point here, but it is still not high enough for anyone to climb over.  The plains continue onward to the north and east.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: This is the heart of the plains.  Brilliant green grass abounds in every direction, seemingly never coming to an end.  Other than all the grass that is all around, only a few other things can be seen.  A few small shrubs and other small desert like plants lie scattered along the plains as well as a few wide trees in the distance.  A good portion of the grass around here has been eaten but what is left of it still sways in the wind.  The plains continue in all directions but to the north where a medium sized water hole presides.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: Overlooking the rolling and seemingly endless plains, many things can be seen.  Many animals have made their homes here, or travel here regularly to eat and drink, and do all sorts of other things.  Tall and short grasses engulf the plains, the tall ones swaying in tune with the wind, the short regrowing themselves to feed the large variety of animals that need the grass to live. A few small pools of water lie scattered around from a previous rain, that have not yet been soaked up by the fertile ground.  A few small shrubs, and other small desert plants lie scattered along the plains, providing something new for the animals to see, and to eat.  A few wide spread trees can be seen off in the distance, providing shade from the hot sun.  The plains continue onward in all directions.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: Overlooking the rolling and seemingly endless plains, many things can be seen.  Many animals have made their homes here, or travel here regularly to eat and drink, and do all sorts of other things.  Tall and short grasses engulf the plains, the tall ones swaying in tune with the wind, the short regrowing themselves to feed the large variety of animals that need the grass to live. A few small pools of water lie scattered around from a previous rain, that have not yet been soaked up by the fertile ground.  A few small shrubs, and other small desert plants lie scattered along the plains, providing something new for the animals to see, and to eat.  A few wide spread trees can be seen off in the distance, providing shade from the hot sun.  The plains continue onward in all directions but to the north where a clump of trees preside.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: The plains end abruptly to the south and east where, a large wall of rock blocks any exit.  It is a mystery how these plains were made because all around them, they are surrounded by desert.  Sand blows in from over the wall of stone and flies around everywhere covering some of the green grass with its dull tan color.  A large carcass stripped clean of all meat lies against the wall, it must have been good meal for the lions that roam these plains.  The plains continue onward to the north and west

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: Overlooking the rolling and seemingly endless plains, many things can be seen.  Many animals have made their homes here, or travel here regularly to eat and drink, and do all sorts of other things.  Tall and short grasses engulf the plains, the tall ones swaying in tune with the wind, the short regrowing themselves to feed the large variety of animals that need the grass to live. A few small pools of water lie scattered around from a previous rain, that have not yet been soaked up by the fertile ground.  A few small shrubs, and other small desert plants lie scattered along the plains, providing something new for the animals to see, and to eat.  A few wide spread trees can be seen off in the distance, providing shade from the hot sun.  The plains continue onward in all directions but to the north, where a small stream presides.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: Overlooking the rolling and seemingly endless plains, many things can be seen.  Many animals have made their homes here, or travel here regularly to eat and drink, and do all sorts of other things.  Tall and short grasses engulf the plains, the tall ones swaying in tune with the wind, the short regrowing themselves to feed the large variety of animals that need the grass to live. A few small pools of water lie scattered around from a previous rain, that have not yet been soaked up by the fertile ground.  A few small shrubs, and other small desert plants lie scattered along the plains, providing something new for the animals to see, and to eat.  A few wide spread trees can be seen off in the distance, providing shade from the hot sun.  The plains continue onward in all directions but to the north, where a small stream presides.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: The plains end abruptly to the south and west where, a large wall of rock blocks any exit.  It is a mystery how these plains were made because all around them, they are surrounded by desert.  Sand blows in from over the wall of stone and flies around everywhere covering some of the green grass with its dull tan color.  A few scattered shrubs and other smaller plants grow along and around the wall of rock, providing the herbivores here with another type of food to eat, besides grass.  The plains continue onward to the north and east.

rooms.name: The Water Hole
rooms.description: This is the most important and most visited site of these plains.  It is the water hole.  This is where all the animals get their daily drinks of like giving water.  Without this water these plains would just be another barren desert, and all the animals would have no place to live.  The water hole itself is the end of a small stream coming in from the west.  It looks like a natural dam has stopped the flow of the stream and made this pool of water.  The plains continue on to the north, south and east.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: This is the heart of the plains.  Brilliant green grass abounds in every direction, seemingly never coming to an end.  Other than all the grass that is all around, only a few other things can be seen.  A few small shrubs and other small desert like plants lie scattered along the plains as well as a few wide trees in the distance.  A good portion of the grass around here has been eaten but what is left of it still sways in the wind.  To the east a clump of trees being, while to the west a medium sized water hole presides.  The plains continue on to the north and south.

rooms.name: A Clump of Trees
rooms.description: This is an unusual sight on these plains, trees.  These trees spread out for several feet and provide nice shade for any animal that might want it.  The trees themselves are not tall but they spread out about twenty feet in diameter.  Many of the green leaves of these trees are still attached but a small portion of them look to have been eaten by some hungry animal.  A few rays of sunlight barely make it through the branches but the heat from them is barely felt.  The trees continue to the north and east, while the plains lie to the south and west.

rooms.name: A Clump of Trees
rooms.description: This is an unusual sight on these plains, trees.  These trees spread out for several feet and provide nice shade for any animal that might want it.  The trees themselves are not tall but they spread out about twenty feet in diameter.  Many of the green leaves of these trees are still attached but a small portion of them look to have been eaten by some hungry animal.  A few rays of sunlight barely make it through the branches but the heat from them is barely felt.  The exit to the east is blocked off by a large wall of rock that encircles the plains.  The clump of trees continue to the north and west while the plains linger to the south.

rooms.name: A Small Stream
rooms.description: This is the only stream located on the Gothra Plains.  Its beginning is to towards west and it continues on through the plains to the east.  This stream is one of the most visited sites in the plains, where many animals flock here to drink, bathe and do several other things.  The stream itself is only about two or three feet deep but it has enough water to provide for all the plains. Its dull tan color is from all the dirt and sand that is kicked up by the animals, and mixes with the clear water.  The end of this small stream lies to the east, while the plains spread out to the north and south.

rooms.name: A Small Stream
rooms.description: This is the only stream located on the Gothra Plains.  Its beginning is to towards north and it continues on through the plains to the east.  This stream is one of the most visited sites in the plains, where many animals flock here to drink, bathe and do several other things.  The stream itself is only about two or three feet deep but it has enough water to provide for all the plains. Its dull tan color is from all the dirt and sand that is kicked up by the animals, and mixes with the clear water.  The plains spread outward to the south and west.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: The plains end abruptly to the west where, a large wall of rock blocks any exit.  It is a mystery how these plains were made because all around them, they are surrounded by desert.  Sand blows in from over the wall of stone and flies around everywhere covering some of the green grass with its dull tan color.  A large carcass stripped clean of all meat lies against the wall, it must have been good meal for the lions that roam these plains.  A small stream flows through the plains to the north and east, while the plains lie to the south.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: This is the heart of the plains.  Brilliant green grass abounds in every direction, seemingly never coming to an end.  Other than all the grass that is all around, only a few other things can be seen.  A few small shrubs and other small desert like plants lie scattered along the plains as well as a few wide trees in the distance.  A good portion of the grass around here has been eaten but what is left of it still sways in the wind.  Several tracks of several different animals can be seen coming in from the south, where the water hole presides.  Other than to the south, the plains continue in every direction.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: The land rises slightly here, providing an excellent view of almost all of the plains.  Overlooking the rolling and seemingly endless plains, many things can be seen.  Many animals have made their homes here, or travel here regularly to eat and drink, and do all sorts of other things.  Tall and short grasses engulf the plains, the tall ones swaying in tune with the wind, the short regrowing themselves to feed the large variety of animals that need the grass to live.  A few small pools of water lie scattered around from a previous rain, that have not yet been soaked up by the fertile ground.  A few small shrubs, and other small desert plants lie scattered along the plains, providing something new for the animals to see, and to eat.  A few wide spread trees can be seen off in the distance, providing shade from the hot sun.  The plains continue onward in all directions but to the east where a clump of trees preside.

rooms.name: A Clump of Trees
rooms.description: This is an unusual sight on these plains, trees.  These trees spread out for several feet and provide nice shade for any animal that might want it.  The trees themselves are not tall but they spread out about twenty feet in diameter.  Many of the green leaves of these trees are still attached but a small portion of them look to have been eaten by some hungry animal.  A few rays of sunlight barely make it through the branches but the heat from them is barely felt.  The clump of trees continue to the south and east while the plains spread out to the north and west.

rooms.name: A Clump of Trees
rooms.description: This is an unusual sight on these plains, trees.  These trees spread out for several feet and provide nice shade for any animal that might want it.  The trees themselves are not tall but they spread out about twenty feet in diameter.  Many of the green leaves of these trees are still attached but a small portion of them look to have been eaten by some hungry animal.  A few rays of sunlight barely make it through the branches but the heat from them is barely felt.  The exit to the east is blocked off by a large wall of rock that encircles the plains.  The clump of trees continue to the south and west while the plains linger to the north.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: The land rises slightly here, providing an excellent view of almost all of the plains.  Tall and short grasses engulf the plains, the tall ones swaying in tune with the wind, the short regrowing themselves to feed the large variety of animals that need the grass to live.  A few small shrubs, and other small desert plants lie scattered along the plains, providing something new for the animals to see, and to eat.  The plains are to the north and east while a small stream travels through the plains to the south and west.

rooms.name: A Small Stream
rooms.description: This is the only stream located on the Gothra Plains.  Its beginning is to towards west and it continues on through the plains to the south.  This stream is one of the most visited sites in the plains, where many animals flock here to drink, bathe and do several other things.  The stream itself is only about two or three feet deep but it has enough water to provide for all the plains. Its dull tan color is from all the dirt and sand that is kicked up by the animals, and mixes with the clear water.  A clump of trees lie to the north while the stream continues to the south and the plains to the east.

rooms.name: The Beginning of a Small Stream
rooms.description: This is the site of the very beginning of a small life-giving stream.  It seems to have come out of nowhere and is making its way slowly through the plains.  This stream is one of the most visited sites in the plains, where many animals flock here to drink, bathe and do several other things.  The stream itself is only about two or three feet deep but it has enough water to provide for all the plains.  Its dull tan color is from all the dirt and sand that is kicked up by the animals, and mixes with the clear water.  A clump of trees lies to the north while the stream continues on to the east.  The plains to spread out to the south.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: This is the most common sight on the plains, endless grass.  It spreads out far and wide providing an almost endless amount of food for all the animals that live here.  Almost all of the grass here is still intact, but small portions of it are gone and look to have been devoured by hungry animals. Very few things other than grass grow here, but a few small shrubs and other various small desert plants can be seen dotted along the plains.  The plains continue on in all directions except to the north, where the entrance to a large cave can be seen.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: This is the most common sight on the plains, endless grass.  It spreads out far and wide providing an almost endless amount of food for all the animals that live here.  Almost all of the grass here is still intact, but small portions of it are gone and look to have been devoured by hungry animals. Very few things other than grass grow here, but a few small shrubs and other various small desert plants can be seen dotted along the plains.  The plains continue on in all directions except to the north, where the entrance to a large cave can be seen.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: Overlooking the rolling and seemingly endless plains, many things can be seen.  Many animals have made their homes here, or travel here regularly to eat and drink, and do all sorts of other things.  Tall and short grasses engulf the plains, the tall ones swaying in tune with the wind, the short regrowing themselves to feed the large variety of animals that need the grass to live. A few small pools of water lie scattered around from a previous rain, that have not yet been soaked up by the fertile ground.  A few small shrubs, and other small desert plants lie scattered along the plains, providing something new for the animals to see, and to eat.  A few wide spread trees can be seen off in the distance, providing shade from the hot sun.  The plains continue onward in all directions but to the south where a clump of trees preside.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: The plains end abruptly to the east where, a large wall of rock blocks any exit.  It is a mystery how these plains were made because all around them, they are surrounded by desert.  Sand blows in from over the wall of stone and flies around everywhere covering some of the green grass with its dull tan color. The stone wall seems to be growing in height and looks to keep getting higher to the north.  The plains continue to the north and west while a clump of trees begins to the south.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: Overlooking the rolling and seemingly endless plains, many things can be seen.  Tall and short grasses engulf the plains, the tall ones swaying in tune with the wind, the short regrowing themselves to feed the large variety of animals that need the grass to live.  A few small shrubs, and other small desert plants lie scattered along the plains, providing something new for the animals to see, and to eat.  The plains continue to the south and east, while a clump of trees lie to the west.  To the north lies the entrance to a large cave.

rooms.name: A Clump of Trees
rooms.description: This is an unusual sight on these plains, trees.  These trees spread out for several feet and provide nice shade for any animal that might want it.  The trees themselves are not tall but they spread out about twenty feet in diameter.  Many of the green leaves of these trees are still attached but a small portion of them look to have been eaten by some hungry animal.  A few rays of sunlight barely make it through the branches but the heat from them is barely felt.  The trees continue to the north and west, while the plains lie to the east.  To the south lies a small stream, making its way through the plains.

rooms.name: A Clump of Trees
rooms.description: This is an unusual sight on these plains, trees.  These trees spread out for several feet and provide nice shade for any animal that might want it.  The trees themselves are not tall but they spread out about twenty feet in diameter.  Many of the green leaves of these trees are still attached but a small portion of them look to have been eaten by some hungry animal.  A few rays of sunlight barely make it through the branches but the heat from them is barely felt.  The trees continue to the north and east, while a small stream begins to the south.  A small break in the rock wall surrounding these plains lies to the west, leading off into a small path.

rooms.name: Before a Large Den
rooms.description: The plains suddenly stop here in front of a large cave.  It looks like a den of some sort, and from all the bones seen scattered around it, it looks to hold some powerful beasts.  The entrance to the cave is about ten feet high, the depth of the cave is unknown because of the shroud of darkness that covers the inside of the cave.  The cave itself lies to the north while the plains stretch out back to the south.  To the east and west the caves entrance continues.

rooms.name: Before a Large Den
rooms.description: The plains suddenly stop here in front of a large cave.  It looks like a den of some sort, and from all the bones seen scattered around it, it looks to hold some powerful beasts.  The entrance to the cave is about ten feet high, the depth of the cave is unknown because of the shroud of darkness that covers the inside of the cave.  The cave itself lies to the north while the plains stretch out to the south and east.  To the west the caves entrance continues.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: The plains end abruptly to the north, where a large wall of rock blocks any exit.  Sand blows in from over the wall of stone and flies around everywhere covering some of the green grass with its dull tan color.  Heat radiates off the dusty plains, creating wavy illusions that distort everything in the area. A half eaten carcass of a zebra lies in a large pool of its own blood, being consumed by small flies and maggots.  The plains continue onward to the south and east while a large den makes itself visible to the west.

rooms.name: The Plains
rooms.description: The plains end abruptly to the north and east where, a large wall of rock blocks any exit.  It is a mystery how these plains were made because all around them, they are surrounded by desert.  Sand blows in from over the wall of stone and flies around everywhere covering some of the green grass with its dull tan color.  The wall seems to have come to a peak here and continues onward into the desert beyond view.  The plains continue onward to the south and west.

rooms.name: Before a Large Den
rooms.description: The plains suddenly stop here in front of a large cave.  It looks like a den of some sort, and from all the bones seen scattered around it, it looks to hold some powerful beasts.  The entrance to the cave is about ten feet high, the depth of the cave is unknown because of the shroud of darkness that covers the inside of the cave.  The cave itself lies to the north while the plains stretch out back to the south.  To the west a large clump of trees begin, while to the east, the caves entrance continues.

rooms.name: A Clump of Trees
rooms.description: This is an unusual sight on these plains, trees.  These trees spread out for several feet and provide nice shade for any animal that might want it.  The trees themselves are not tall but they spread out about twenty feet in diameter.  Many of the green leaves of these trees are still attached but a small portion of them look to have been eaten by some hungry animal.  A few rays of sunlight barely make it through the branches but the heat from them is barely felt.  The clump of trees continue on to the south and west.  To the east lies the entrance to a cave of some sort.

rooms.name: A Clump of Trees
rooms.description: This is an unusual sight on these plains, trees.  These trees spread out for several feet and provide nice shade for any animal that might want it.  The trees themselves are not tall but they spread out about twenty feet in diameter.  Many of the green leaves of these trees are still attached but a small portion of them look to have been eaten by some hungry animal.  A few rays of sunlight barely make it through the branches but the heat from them is barely felt.  The clump of trees continue to the south and east.  The way north and west is blocked off by a wall of stone that surrounds the plains.

rooms.name: In the Lions' Den
rooms.description: The light that covered everything outside has completely vanished, leaving this cave in complete darkness.  Many bones and carcasses line the edges of the cave, the smell of the rotting flesh engulfs the cave in a almost unbearable putrid smell.  Whatever beasts live here look to be the main hunters of these plains, feared by every animal that dwells on the plains.  The cave comes to an end to the north , but continues on to the east and west.  The only exit from this cave is to the south, back towards the plains.

rooms.name: In the Lions' Den
rooms.description: The light that covered everything outside has completely vanished, leaving this cave in complete darkness.  Many bones and carcasses line the edges of the cave, the smell of the rotting flesh engulfs the cave in a almost unbearable putrid smell.  Whatever beasts live here look to be the main hunters of these plains, feared by every animal that dwells on the plains.  The cave comes to an end to the north and east , but continues on to the west.  The only exit from this cave is to the south, back towards the plains.

rooms.name: In the Lions' Den
rooms.description: The light that covered everything outside has completely vanished, leaving this cave in complete darkness.  Many bones and carcasses line the edges of the cave, the smell of the rotting flesh engulfs the cave in a almost unbearable putrid smell.  Whatever beasts live here look to be the main hunters of these plains, feared by every animal that dwells on the plains.  The cave comes to an end to the north and west, but continues on to the east.  The only exit from this cave is to the south, back towards the plains.

rooms.name: A Dusty Desert Path
rooms.description: The path is slowly beginning to ascend here, growing higher with each step. The wind is blowing much harder here, stirring up sand everywhere, making it nearly impossible to see the ground or the nearby surroundings.  A few withering plants can be seen along the path, trying in vain to grow.  To the north and south, enormous sand dunes block off all travel.  The dusty path continues to the west and back towards the desert to the east.

rooms.name: A Dusty Desert Path
rooms.description: This worn dusty path looks to have been traveled many times, by many different animals.  Amongst the sand there are several tracks of various sizes that seem to have mixed in with each other.  This makes it almost impossible to figure out what made these tracks.  Dust and small particles of sand swirl through the area, covering everything in sight with its dull tan color.  The sun beats down unmercifully on the path, making it impossible for almost any plant to grow.  A few small rocks mix themselves in with the sand, making it even harder to travel further down the path.  The path continues on to the west or back towards the seemingly endless desert to the east.

rooms.name: A Dusty Desert Path
rooms.description: The path is slowly beginning to ascend here, growing higher with each step. The wind is blowing much harder here, stirring up sand everywhere, making it nearly impossible to see the ground or the nearby surroundings.  A few withering plants can be seen along the path, trying in vain to grow.  To the north and south, enormous sand dunes block off all travel.  The dusty path continues to the west and back towards the desert to the east.

rooms.name: A Dusty Desert Path
rooms.description: This worn dusty path, seems to have been traveled many times by several different animals.  Amongst the sand there are several tracks of various sizes that seem to have mixed in with each other.  This makes it almost impossible to figure out what made these tracks.  Dust and small particles of sand swirl through the area, covering everything in sight with its dull tan color.  The sun beats down unmercifully on the path, making it impossible for almost any plant to grow.  The path continues on to the west or back into the seemingly endless desert to the east.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: This trail looks to be a migratory path that some of the animals take throughout parts of the year in search of more food and water.  Tall grass covers the edges of the trail where the animals have not beaten it down with their many footprints.  The trail continues on to the west, or heads back into the main part of the plains to the east.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The path grows smaller than at its beginning, the tall grass is much closer than it was before.  It sways in the wind, and is quite high making it hard to see what lies ahead.  Several different types of animal tracks are visible here, showing all the different types of animals to travel this path.  The path continues on to the west, or back towards the main part of the plains to the east.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The direction of the path winds a bit here in the southern direction.  The tall grasses continue to surround this small path, but at a lower height than usual.  Some other vegetation is also cluttered around the path such as small bushes and shrubs.  Even a few small cacti can be seen off to the edge of the path.  The path continues off towards the south, and back towards the main section of the plains to the east.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The trail widens a bit here, as small patches of grass seem to be missing throughout parts surrounding the path.  Off a ways from the path some shrubbery and cacti can be seen through a break in the tall grass.  A single large boulder lies to the east, a few small reptiles resting in the shade that it provides.  The path continues on to the west, or heads back north to the main section of the plains.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The grass grows sparser in this section of the path, but many medium and small sized rocks lie in the way instead.  Several small creatures can be seen lying on and moving about the rocks that surround the area.  Their tracks and others scatter the sandy dirt that covers the path, their directions scattered in almost every direction.  The path winds on towards the south, or goes back towards the plains to the east.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The unusual amount of rocks still scatter the area here, with plenty of small reptiles and other creatures using them for shelter from the sun and homes.  A flock of birds flies overhead to the west, chirping loudly as they go.  The path widens a bit as it continues towards the south, or back towards the main part of the plains to the north.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The grass is sparser in this part of the path, but many medium and small sized rocks lie in the way instead.  Several small creatures can be seen lying on and moving about the rocks that surround the area.  Their tracks and others scatter the sandy dirt that covers the path, scattered in almost every direction.  Some birds can be heard flying overhead, their destination not known.  The path continues on towards the west, or goes back towards the plains to the north.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: A large tree lies on the side of the path here casting a shadow on everything surrounding it.  By the looks of the tree several animals have made their homes in and around its trunk and branches.  Most of its leaves are intact but some of them flutter around along the path and surrounding area. The path continues on to the south, or back towards the plains to the east.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The tall grasses continue to surround the small path, swaying in the wind and blocking view.  Some other vegetation is also cluttered around the path such as small bushes and shrubs.  Even a few small cacti can be seen off to the edge of the path.  The sound of birds can be heard off in the distance, heading in this direction.  The path contines on to the west, and back towards the plains to the north.

rooms.name: A Break In the Plains
rooms.description: The grass seems to have overrun almost the entire path here creating a break.  It is still possible to see the continuation of the path through the swaying grass to the west.  Some slithering sounds can be heard in the grass, but it is hard to make out what and where it is coming from in the tall grass. The break in the path ends to the west, while to the east the path leads back towards the main section of the plains.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The tall grasses continue to surround the small path, swaying in the wind and blocking view.  Off a ways from the path some shrubbery and cacti can be seen through a break in the tall grass.  A few medium sized rocks lie to the east, a few small reptiles resting in the shade that it provides.  The path continues on to the west, or heads back east to the main section of the plains.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The grass is sparser in this part of the path, overrun by animal tracks and a few rocks.  Several small creatures can be seen moving about the area now that the grass isn't so thick.  Their tracks and others scatter the sandy dirt that covers the path, scattered in almost every direction.  Some birds can be heard flying overhead, flying off to an unknown location.  The path continues on towards the south, or goes back towards the plains to the east.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The tall grasses continue to surround the small path, swaying in the wind and blocking view.  Some other vegetation is also cluttered around the path such as small bushes and shrubs.  Even a few small cacti can be seen off to the edge of the path.  The sound of birds can be heard off in the distance, growing fainter as they get farther away.  The path contines on to the west, and back towards the plains to the north.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: A large tree lies on the side of the path here casting a shadow on everything surrounding it.  By the looks of the tree several animals have made their homes in and around its trunk and branches.  Most of its leaves are intact but some of them flutter around along the path and surrounding area. Several tracks of animals can be seen at the base of the tree where the grass has ceased to grow.  The path continues on to the south, or back towards the plains to the east.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The path grows smaller here, the tall grass overrunning the path and is much closer than it was before.  It sways in the wind, and is quite high making it hard to see what lies ahead.  Several different types of animal tracks are visible on the sandy path here, showing all the different types of animals to travel this path.  A light breeze can be felt coming in from the west, along with a smell that cannot be made out.  The path continues on to the west, or back towards the main part of the plains to the north.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The direction of the path winds a bit here in the western direction.  The tall grasses continue to surround this small path, but at a lower height than usual.  Some other vegetation is also cluttered around the path such as small bushes and shrubs.  Even a few small cacti can be seen off to the edge of the path.  A light breeze from the west cools things down a little, countering the hot sun overhead.  The path continues off towards the west, and back towards the main section of the plains to the east.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The path is almost completely overrun here by the tall grass, but it is still possible to make out where the path runs.  Other than the grass small amounts of other vegetation can be seen scattered around the area.  Some small animals scurry around, looking for a place to shield themselves from the sun's hot rays.  The faint smell of the sea is coming in from the west, through a small breeze that cools of the area a little.  The path continues and winds towards the south, or goes towards the main section of the plains to the east.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The grass is sparser in this part of the path, overrun by animal tracks and a few rocks.  Several small creatures can be seen moving about the area now that the grass isn't so thick.  Their tracks and others scatter the sandy dirt that covers the path, scattered in almost every direction.  The smell of the sea can be made out coming from the west, through a light breeze.  The path continues on towards the west, or goes back towards the plains to the north.

rooms.name: Path Through the Ruins
rooms.description: The path crosses through a set of black and grey stone ruins.  The stone is worn by years of animal migration and is broken in many places.  Obelisks are broken and scattered to the north and south of the trail.  The smell of the sea is coming in strong here, through a mild breeze that is blowing in from the west.  The path continues on to the west, and back towards the plains to the east.  There seem to be more ruins to the north, accessible from here through the rubble.

rooms.name: A Small Path Through the Plains
rooms.description: The trail widens here as the trail nears its end, the grass almost completely tramped by the animals.  Some small shrubbery still lies scattered around the area, along with several cacti that have not been trampled.  A smell of the sea blowing in from the west continues here and is much stronger here than in other places along the path.  The path leads back to the main section of the plains to the east.  It looks like it may have continued to the west at one time, but it is now severely overgrown and impassable.

rooms.name: An Old Stone Ruin
rooms.description: A large smooth stone dais has been created here in the middle of the windswept plains of Gothra.  The dais is made of black and grey stone and is very wind and weather worn.  Some obelisks remain standing encircling the dais but most are broken.  There is a large bowl shaped hole hewn very smoothly into the center of the dais.  Several people could stand inside and walk out on each of the stairways exiting the hole in the cardinal directions.  There is a wind constantly blowing in from the west and the smell of sea salt is strong.  The blue of the western sea can be seen on the horizon as the plateau of the Gothra plains can be seen to fall off quickly into a forested foothills and sea plain.
